DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare visual outcomes bilateral implantation Tecnis MF ReSTOR intraocular lens ( IOLs ) 6 month post cataract surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Of Bilateral Tecnis Multifocal Versus ReSTOR 3D Intraocular Lenses
DOC.criteria: Age 18 great Bilateral cataract phacoemulsification extraction posterior IOL implantation plan eye Visual potential 20/30 good eye cataract removal IOL implantation Preoperative bestcorrected distance visual acuity ( BSDVA ) worse 20/40 Snellen . If glare component , glare test reduces visual acuity le 20/40 Naturally dilate pupil size ( dim light ) > 3.5 mm ( dilation medication ) eye Preoperative corneal astigmatism 1.0 D less Clear intraocular medium cataract Availability , willingness , sufficient cognitive awareness comply examination procedure Use systemic ocular medication may affect vision Acute chronic disease illness would increase risk confound study result ( e.g . diabetes mellitus , immunocompromised , etc . ) Subjects diabetes mellitus Uncontrolled systemic ocular disease History ocular trauma prior ocular surgery Amblyopia strabismus Known pathology may affect visual acuity ; particularly retinal change affect vision ( macular degeneration , cystoid macular edema , proliferative diabetic retinopathy , etc . ) Diagnosed degenerative visual disorder ( e.g . macular degeneration , retinal disorder ) predict cause future acuity loss level 20/30 bad Subjects may expect require retinal laser treatment surgical intervention Capsule zonular abnormality may affect postoperative centration tilt lens ( e.g . pseudoexfoliation syndrome ) Pupil abnormality ( nonreactive , tonic pupil , abnormally shape pupil , pupil dilate least 4.0 mm mesopic/scotopic condition ) Contact lens usage within 6 month polymethyl methacrylate ( PMMA ) contact lens , 1 month gas permeable lens 1 week extendedwear dailywear soft contact lenses Requiring intraocular lens < 15.0 > 26.0 diopter
DOC.keyword: Compare visual outcomes bilateral implantation Tecnis MF ReSTOR IOLs 6 month post cataract surgery .
